intro: Cutandia divaricata, commonly known as the variable cutandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
